introtext:
WikiBluff is a game in which knowledge from Wikipedia is faked. Each player (Faker) picks a word from Wikipedia and reads through the corresponding article. Then one word is randomly chosen from all submitted words. Everyone now tries to convince the Guesser that they read the article about the drawn word. Any story can be made up in the process. After presenting and a Q&A round a vote is taken by the Guessers to see who told the truth.

The inspiration came from the YouTube channel of Tom Scott, a sample video in which the rules are explained again is available here.
yourWordIntro:
Want to present an article?

Your word should not be common knowledge. The more abstruse the term, the better. Names of people or words where the interpretations are very narrow should be avoided.

You can also participate without a word, then you will have to always lie.
